intro: Loeseneriella apocynoides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal.
